overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The pilot program shall implement trauma-informed and evidence-based practices, employ gender-responsive programming, collaborate with stakeholders, and provide services to women in the court system with the goal of diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature, and the Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1]
appropriations: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
assumptions_and_methodology: The legislature finds that Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, established a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] This program, known as Mohala Wahine, focuses on non-violent women who are at high risk of recidivism and in need of multiple services. [1] The purpose of this Act is to establish a similar three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1]
agency_impact: There is established within the second, third, and fifth circuits of the judiciary the women's court pilot program. [1] The bill appropriates funds for the establishment of seven temporary positions, including social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature for the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1]
economic_impact: The legislature finds that there has been a significant increase in the number of women in Hawai â€˜ i jails and prisons over the past forty years. [1] The pilot program has the goal of diverting participants from incarceration, supporting their success in the community, and reducing recidivism. [1] Women offenders also face unique barriers to success after incarceration, such as being primary caregivers for young children, having lower educational attainment, and lacking a stable work history. [1]
policy_impact: This Act establishes a temporary three-year woman's court pilot program within the second, third, and fifth circuits. [1] The bill builds upon Act 243, Session Laws of Hawaii 2022, which established a women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the first circuit. [1] This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025, and shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1]
revenue_sources: There is appropriated out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii the sum of $ or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2025-2026. [1] The bill appropriates the same sum or so much thereof as may be necessary for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
six_year_fiscal_implications: This Act shall take effect on July 1, 2025, and shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The bill appropriates an unspecified sum out of the general revenues for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] These funds are for equipment; mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services; and the establishment of seven temporary positions. [1] The temporary positions include full-time equivalent social worker V positions, social worker IV positions, circuit court clerk II positions, and judicial clerk positions. [1] The judiciary shall submit a report of its findings and recommendations to the governor and legislature no later than forty days prior to the convening of the regular sessions of 2026, 2027, and 2028. [1] The report will include the status of the pilot program, the number of women accepted, and the number of women completing the program. [1] It will also provide recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should continue as a pilot program, expand to include additional participants, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [1] The program sunsets on 6/30/2028. [1]
operating_revenue_impact: The provided text does not specify any impact on operating revenues. [1] The bill concerns an appropriation from the general revenues of the State of Hawaii. [1] The sums appropriated shall be expended by the judiciary for the purposes of this Act. [1]
capital_expenditure_impact: The appropriation is for fiscal year 2025-2026 and fiscal year 2026-2027. [1] Part of the appropriation is designated for equipment. [1] The specific sum for equipment is not detailed in the bill. [1]
fiscal_implications_after_6_years: This Act shall be repealed on June 30, 2028. [1] The judiciary's required report includes recommendations as to whether the women's court pilot program should continue as a pilot program, expand, provide additional services, or be discontinued. [1] Any fiscal implications beyond the three-year pilot period are contingent on future legislation based on these recommendations. [1]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: No previous fiscal note was provided in the context.
